Houston made just 1 of 12 shots in overtime.
Eason had three blocks, four steals, and nine rebounds.
Green was ultimately disqualified with eight seconds remaining.
The Golden State Warriors defeated the Houston Rockets in overtime.
Alperen Sengun had 14 points, 10 rebounds, and four assists in 21 minutes.
Tari Eason scored a career-high 27 points in 35 minutes on 11-of-19 shooting.
The Warriors took a 28-point lead into halftime using red-hot shooting and suffocating defense.
Kuminga exploited a size advantage over Green for scores and free throws, taking over in overtime.
Draymond Green fouled out with 8.3 seconds left, sending Eason to the free throw line to tie the game.
Draymond Green should have been whistled for his sixth foul with 1:26 remaining in the fourth quarter.
The Rockets missed their first five shots in overtime, allowing the Warriors to secure a 127-121 victory.
Jonathan Kuminga scored the first two baskets of overtime to make it 123-119. He finished with 23 points.
The Warriors led by 31 points in the first half. The Rockets tied it with an 18-2 run to open the fourth quarter.
Podziemski made crucial shots in the last few minutes of regulation, including scoring over Jalen Green and Jabari Smith Jr.
The Warriors led by five before a 3-pointer by Jabari Smith Jr. cut the lead to 119-117 with 15.5 seconds to go in regulation.
Golden State scored the first six points in overtime to make it 125-119 and went on to a third straight win without Steph Curry.
Eason had a clutch steal early in the fourth quarter while having five fouls, contributing to Houston's attempted 31-point comeback.
Jonathan Kuminga and Brandin Podziemski displayed star scoring chops to rescue the Warriors from an embarrassing loss to the Rockets.
Buddy Hield scored 27 points and the Golden State Warriors squandered a huge lead before outlasting the Houston Rockets 127-121 in overtime.
Tari Eason and Amen Thompson spearheaded Houston's comeback, with Golden State missing 18 free throws and going six minutes without a field goal.
Aaron Holiday stole the ball from Draymond Green and he fouled out a few seconds later. Tari Eason made two free throws after that to send it to overtime.
